title: Chef De Piece, ""L'Abreuvoir" (The Well)", 1792–1815
medium:
Medium: plain weave cotton
Technique: printed by engraved plate
inscribed: Stamp at one end bearing the mark of Oberkampf factory in use from 1792 to 1815.(in black) Also in black: 51945, 14, RD 248 and 25. In red: M.M enclosed in a box. Handwritten in black ink: 248A. Also there are some faint impressions of other numbers which cannot be read. Note: the 5 in front on the 1945 is in a different font and a different type of ink.
provenance: Formerly in the collection of Elinor Merrell where it was No. 2 on her list of chefs de piece.
dimensions:
Height: 63cm (24 3/4in.). Width: 145cm (55 1/4in.) N.B. As the piece is quilted to a backing fabric with no apparent warp or weft, measurements were taken as Height and Width.
Pattern: Not present in piece.
description: Design in red on white. Several scenes including dancing couple, rural inn and boys bowling.

tombstone.epitaph:
Chef De Piece, ""L'Abreuvoir" (The Well)", 1792–1815.Medium: plain weave cotton
Technique: printed by engraved plate. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-2.
